Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2008 04:36PM cm1122 wrote: Great threads here. I finished radiation in May 08, and since then have been diagnosed with 2 (I say 1 continuous, never really recovered) skin infection, left breast goes from mildly pink to reddish purple; feels tender and hot. I'm still on antibiotics, but the color is still the same. Is it normal for discoloration to last this long? I worry about Inflammatory BC ("often mis-diagnosed as skin infection") but maybe it's just lingering side effects from the radiation.....I had my first mammo last week, and it hurt a little but not unbearable, and the "looks great!! See you next year" was worth the pain!
Posts.Title: How Long Do Radiation Side Effects Last? kajo cm1122

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2008 10:16AM cm1122 wrote: Hi Shirlann, thank you, I know I was kind of jumping subjects there, I know IBC needs a biopsy to confirm, which my docs say is next if the infection (or whatever) doesn't go away after the antibiotics are done. Sorry to be a downer!!  My comment on the mammo was supposed to be the good news!! I know how unlikely it is, and both docs say don't worry (yet), but as you say we're all jumpy for awhile!!
Posts.Title: How Long Do Radiation Side Effects Last? kajo cm1122

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2008 10:15AM cm1122 wrote: That made me laugh!! And I needed that!!  Well my breast is still red, after almost finishing my antibiotics, so I go Friday to my surgeon for re-check. Hope it's still an infection!! Fingers and toes crossed... P.S. Love your cat!!
